DOC.brief_summary: Multiple different device available provide Bubble CPAP preterm newborn infant . The significant difference device size bubble produce exhalation limb . This study determine one Bubble CPAP device ( BabiPlus v B & B ) effective improve oxygenation decrease extubation failure extremely low birthweight population .
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Effectiveness Study Bubble CPAP Devices NICU
DOC.detailed_description: Primary outcome : Bubble CPAP failure ( re-intubation use non-invasive positive pressure ventilation ) within 72 hour follow extubation Secondary outcome : Number infant reach 21 % inspired oxygen initial study period Secondary outcome : Apnea/bradycardia event initial study period Secondary outcome : Mean oxygen requirement follow initial study period Population : Infants bear < =1250 gram birth weight > = 500 gram birth weight Randomization : Equal allocation stratify gestational age ( < 27 week , > =27 week ) Study diagram : 72h 24h X -- -- -- -- -- > X1 -- -- -- -- -- - > Y2 Y -- -- -- -- -- > Y1 -- -- -- -- -- - > X2 Infants randomly assign treatment X ( BabiPlus , control group ) treatment Y ( B & B Bubbler , intervention group ) . The primary outcome bubble CPAP failure first 72 hour follow extubation , measure time point 1 diagram . Bubble CPAP failure define require re-intubation non-invasive positive pressure ventilation ( NIPPV ) , require FiO2 > 60 % one hour pCO2 measurement > 65 mm Hg . For infant remain CPAP initial study period , number reach 21 % inspired oxygen > 12 consecutive hour compare group . This difference also analyze use Chi square test . Those infant remain CPAP follow 72 hour initial study period ( e.g. , meet primary outcome criterion ) cross opposite treatment arm least 24 hour . The minimum oxygen requirement require keep saturation order range , per standard NICU guideline , record compare time point 1 2 . This study design complex due nature disease patient . Each day every infant 's premature pulmonary disease evolve . There way control .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Infant deliver > =500 gram < =1250 gram birth weight . 2 . Infant require intubation mechanical ventilation within first 48 hour follow delivery . 3 . Infant receive exogenous surfactant mechanical ventilation . 1 . Decision attend physician redirect comfort care 2 . Congenital condition precludes use CPAP ( choanal atresia , diaphragmatic hernia , etc . ) 3 . Birth weight > 1250 gram < 500 gram . 4 . NonEnglish speaking parent .
